name: Parrot Key Hotel and Resort

reviews.text: We stayed at the Parrot Key Hotel only one night. We wished we were going to be there longer. We were a little put off pulling into the resort as it was next to a very busy road and shared a driveway with a very busy Walgreens which is, literally, right next door. Our room was almost next to the busy road and we were worried the noise would be a problem with our sound-sensitive family, however, it was not an issue at all. The room was very quiet and we never noticed the Walgreens or Home Depot unless we left the resort. Pool areas were great, though we all thought the pool was too bright after dark (big spotlights on!) and closed about an hour too early. Landscaping is incredible! Wonderful walkways all through the resort. Very nice tiki bar that was an even nicer place to have breakfast. Highly recommend this resort!
reviews.title: Wonderful oasis!

reviews.text: We stayed 7 nights at Parrot Key Resort in Key West. This was one of the best vacations of my life. There are jet skies on property that we rented...had a blast. Room was VERY clean. Beds were super nice/soft-had a very good night's sleep. Staff were friendly and attentive. There are FOUR pools to enjoy with a cafe at the main pool for breakfast and lunch. I miss the place already!! We will definitely be staying here again and again. We're already planning a trip back to Parrot Key next summer!!!!
reviews.title: Traveled the country...this was the best!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay here especially considering the price. We got a 2 story condo room even though we didn't pay for that. There was an entire bedroom and bathroom upstairs that we didn't even use and a living room outside of our bedroom. The place was immaculate. Although the maids service could really be improved. They didn't come in during the day until around 5...which is exactly the time of day we are always back at our hotel relaxing and getting ready for dinner. Not to mention showering! They probably saw my husband naked at one point. When they would finally come in, they would often leave way too many regular towels but not give us our beach towels back. But anyway, that seemed minor all in all.
reviews.title: Very nice, renovated, clean, super comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very nice and the beds....oh my....SO comfortable!!
reviews.title: We were thrilled

reviews.text: The only reason I gave Parrot Key 4 stars is because of they are not located near a lot of things and maybe don't have the best view. But even though we couldn't see the water, we had 2 porches and the back view was beautiful with lush palm trees and flowers overlooking the pool. There are 4 pools and we enjoyed hanging out by those in the afternoon and getting a drink at the bar. (Make sure you bring your ID. The bartender refused to serve me even though I'm 30!)
reviews.title: Parrot Key is a resort experience at hotel rates.

reviews.text: Very nice accomodations. Just as pictured at their website. We've stayed there twice (May, 2009 and May, 2011). Both stays were great. We had a 3 bedroom cottage the first time and a 2 bedroom suite the second time. Very clean. Very comfortable beds. It's about 3 miles from Duval Street, which is just the way I like it.... Duval Street is fun, but I like being able to escape from the craziness. I would definitely recommend Parrot Key to anyone wanting quiet time at the end of the day. Love this place and will stay again if I ever get back to Key West.
reviews.title: I really like this place

reviews.text: What a beautiful place to stay!! Parrot Key is spacious and updated, but still has all the charm of Key West. I have stayed in Key West many times, and this is my favorite place yet. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with plenty of room for everyone. I stayed with my best friend and two teenage sons - and we all LOVED it! The view from the porches is stunning...the water is beautiful, of course - but the gardens surrounding the property are gorgeous.
reviews.title: Best stay in Key West!

reviews.text: They have exceptional service and a very friendly, and helpful staff...especially Rutanya at the front desk.
reviews.title: Loved it, look forward to re-visit

reviews.text: The swimming pools are small, and therefore quite warm - like bathwater and don't offer much relief in the summer. We didn't mind too much - we would rather spend our time on the Gulf or in the Atlantic.
reviews.title: Resort is nice, location is ok, pools are nice, no real access to the ocean as the beach in the pictures is not really a beach..

reviews.text: Mallory Square and Duval are close, and there are plenty of stores and restaurants that are super convenient to Parrot Key. We will definitely be back, already looking at our trip for next year - and plan on staying at Parrot Key of course!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Great Key West Hotel
reviews.text: We were on a family trip and loved the space this hotel room offered us. It was nicely decorated, clean and very comfortable. The front desk staff was helpful, especially Rutanya Hardin who went out of her way to help us stay an additional night which made our trip complete. Her service was excellent and we would recommend the Parrot Key.

Just came from a 3-night stay with my family including 2 teenage daughters. I'm amused by some of the reviews here expressing disappointment at "no beach" given that there is NOTHING on Parrot Key's website that would indicate the resort has a beach, only a "sandy, sunning terrace." We also had no problems with parking or with housekeeping, as some others have expressed here.
reviews.title: Relaxing, beautiful, top-notch!

reviews.text: I admit I was nervous when we pulled in to the resort, given the proximity of the Home Depot and Walgreens. But when we entered the resort grounds I was pleasantly surprised. The setup and landscaping are very private and lush, like a secluded tropical garden. The four small pools are so relaxing; there is none of the loud, rowdy, "cannonball" behavior you might find at a larger resort with one big pool. We enjoyed lunch at the poolside grill (delicious, although expensive), and bartenders Mindi and Shelley are both VERY generous with drinks! TIP: if you're looking for a budget-friendly, quick breakfast, hit Goldman's Deli across the street in the shopping center.
reviews.title: Can't wait to stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 2-bedroom suite which was perfect for a family with teens. Two full bathrooms and 3 flat-screen tv's. No problems with the wi-fi. The balconies were both also very private. I felt like I was sitting in a tropical treehouse.
reviews.title: Where's the Beach?

reviews.text: We did have a small issue with the bed in the upstairs bedroom. The frame was a little loose resulting in very loud creaking that woke us all up every time one of my daughters rolled over. I alerted the front desk in the morning and it was fixed by the time we returned that afternoon.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Key West

reviews.text: This hotel that should be rated a five star resort in Key West. I felt like I was staying at the Ritz Carlton! The customer service is superior to none. The grounds are lush and the architecture is authentic. The rooms are adorable and roomy. My kids loved the four pools! I loved the individual artwork at each pool.
reviews.title: Modern Surrondings with Old Florida Charm

reviews.text: If you can stay at Parrot Key, consider yourself lucky. It's truly amazing!
reviews.title: Clean, friendly and valued priced

reviews.text: Excellent stay.
reviews.title: Parrot Key Was Perfect

reviews.text: Nice pools.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Relaxing, and close to everything.

reviews.text: Large rooms with clean bathroom.
reviews.title: Absolutely Terrific!

description: Experience the Key West you’ve always dreamed of with endless sunshine, glorious sunsets, and incomparable charm. Parrot Key Hotel and Resort is the newest luxury waterfront hotel in Key West, offering the largest rooms with the most square footage in the Keys. Located on the Gulf of Mexico, just minutes from Historic Old Town, indulge in island living with authentic Conch-style design and details that guests have come to know and love. Set among five acres of award-winning landscaping and palm groves, our waterfront Key West Florida hotel features four dramatic, secluded swimming pools, each nestled in its own garden paradise. Experience white-sand sunbathing terraces, spectacular sunsets, onsite water sports, and of course, the electric happenings of Key West. Just outside your front door, enjoy casual barefoot dining and refreshments poolside, at Cafe Blue, one of Singh Resort’s fresh and original restaurants.
